alert.note: Alert for Bee; Goliad; Live Oak; McMullen (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 7:33PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern McMullen, west central Goliad, Live Oak and western Bee Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kenedy to near Pawnee to near Oakville to 7 miles southwest of Simmons. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beeville, George West, Three Rivers, Choke Canyon, Mineral, River Creek Acres, Calliham, Nell, Tulsita, Karon, Normanna, Oakville, Pettus, Pawnee, Simmons, Ray Point, Esseville, Dinero, Tuleta and Whitsett. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 47 and 83. US Highway 281 between mile markers 618 and 642. US Highway 181 between mile markers 572 and 592. US Highway 59 between mile markers 690 and 730. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas.
